msContents.summary: A tax receipt addressed to Theodoros, son of Obodianos, by Flavius Kyrikos on behalf of his wife Arista. The document was drawn up for Kyrikos by Flavius Nonnos, son of Auxon, who may have been a military prior in Sadaqa. Kyrikos acknowledges that he and Arista have received taxes from Theodoros for a certain piece of grainland situated in a place called Sargadi[ , probably in or near Sadaqa.

msItemStruct.note: Written transversa charta acros the ﬁbers. Found alongside 38, the documents were rolled separately but bundled together and tied with a string. Top margin at least 2 cm and bottom margin 3 cm. Nonnos' handwriting is a quite easily legible cursive but he has problems with most vowels. Kyrikos has subscribed the end of the document. In addition, the hands of three witnesses are present.

div.ab: (Lines 1–7) To [the most God-pleasing] Theodoros, son of Obodianos, archdeacon of the most holy church of . . . the Metropolis, originating from it, [but residing temporarily] in Kastron Zadakathon, [Flavius Kyrikos, son of N, . . . . . ] on behalf of the most virtuous Arista, [daughter of N, . . . ] having her domicile and temporarily residing in the most holy . . . greetings. (Lines 7–14) I agree through this my receipt that I have received [and] have been paid [by you] . . . the . . . [from the . . . ] indiction of the past [ . . . year . . . until the . . . ] t(e)enth indiction, for one sixth of the place Sarg Adi[ , every year] for one, one half, one twenty-fourth . . . iugerum, one fourth . . . . . of the said tax . . . . . (Lines 15–26) . . . of [my?] spouse from the inheritance [of the] most blessed [N, son of N,] and the other two thirds of the tax for [the same plot pertain] to the most magniﬁcent Ailianos, son of Monaxios, illustris, [and] to the most God-pleasing Ioannes, son of Ouares, . . . and to be paid . . . . . of the above-written grainland . . . my spouse, for the said twenty-ﬁve years,[and] I agree with my own personal liability and that of my property that not [me or my] said [spouse] nor her heirs or successors has any claim . . . . . of the afore-mentioned plot [ . . . up to the . . . ] t(e)enth indiction and including (it). (Lines 26–39) And I afﬁrm this [ . . . without] any treachery, with my own personal liability and that of my property and . . . . . from the eleventh [indiction . . . . . ] my spouse, of the above-mentioned . . . of the same tax to the sacred houses of the [holy and] glorious . . . and Theodoros the Martyr [in] Zadakathon, the said Kastron, . . . to my most blessed father-in-law N, from [ . . . ceded] by him to the same holy houses and . . . the heirs and successors, and free from liability [and] unharmed [and] undisturbed and . . . keep . . . and the heirs [and] successors . . . (Lines 40–48) . . . her successors, rent . . . not requesting from you the accounts for the sake of the above-written tax for the preceding [and following?] times . . . to pledge . . . . . and for [your] security [I have issued this receipt], written by the hand of Flavius Nonnos, son of Auxon, prior?, I myself [having asked] him to write [this] for me, because I write very little. [It was written] on the thirtieth [of the month X] of the year four hundred sixty- . . . and I have signed. (Lines 48–59) (2.
